Even though [b]Portal[/b] is a lauded game I had a few skepticism one that the game is old and the graphics would be terrible and secondly it being a puzzle game it won't be able to captivate my interest or keep me hinged for a long time also I might get stuck at some level and would have to leave the game there. Even though I went for it and after completing it I haven't felt this satisfied after completing a game. Now going over how this game overcame each of my skepticism one by one -
1. Yes the game is aged but it has aged well comparing it to other game in its era the graphics are pretty good and setting/environment is pretty minimalistic so the game never demands any need for high graphics quality, overall the game looks good and this generation of gamers should not have any major problem with how the game looks.
2. The game is very well designed and very well paced with some clever dialouge into the mix I was totally into the game.
The setting is dark and there is a sense of mystery as you progress along the storyline. The dialouges are good with some dark sense of humour and great voice acting(I was weirdly feeling sad for the antagonist at the end just because of the great voice acting), As you progress along the storyline it unfurl the story thread by thread keeping you captivated and the game is not lengthy just the right amount as you would expect a puzzle game should be, I was able to complete this game in 4 hours in a single sitting although you can approach it in more of a laidback way.
3. This game manages to strike the right balance in terms of puzzle difficulty , the difficulty increases organically and you will feel accomplished after solving the later puzzles . The puzzles are neither too easy nor impossible they are difficult enough to challenge you and after completing them you might end up appreciating your intelligence which is what I want from a puzzle game.
Plus the end credits in this game is probably the best end credits I have ever seen!
With the sale going on this game is a [u]steal[/u] especially with portal 2 combo.
Valve we need #[b]Half-Life3[/b] and #[b]Portal3[/b]

Portal is a puzzle game where you are a test subject and must solve a variety of puzzles using different mechanics. The game is full of mystery, you never know whose watching you solve the puzzles or who is watching you solve them which adds to the uneasy feeling that everything isnt as it seems. Portal also features a variety of challenge maps where they make a small changes to a test you've already completed that adds to the challenge. Portal is a fun puzzle game and isnt too challenging to solve the puzzles but will require a bit of logical thinking but the story is very strong, it's a lot of show dont tell and it works really well. I would highly reccomend.
